intro: Ruellia elegans, commonly known as the elegant ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of blue or purple tubular flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments. Ruellia elegans is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
